SEARCH
Package aor.fpbackend.bean

Class ProjectBean

java.lang.Object
aor.fpbackend.bean.ProjectBean
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ProjectBean extends Object implements Serializable
ProjectBean is a stateless session bean responsible for managing project-related operations within the system.
This bean handles the creation, updating, retrieval, and logging of projects. It interacts with various DAOs to perform CRUD operations on project entities, user entities, and related entities.

Key functionalities provided by this bean include:
  • Creating new projects and defining their relationships with users, skills, keywords, and assets.
  • Updating existing projects with new details and managing their state transitions.
  • Retrieving project details and converting them to DTOs for presentation purposes.
  • Logging project-related activities and changes for auditing and tracking purposes.


The class uses dependency injection to obtain instances of various beans and DAOs, promoting a clean architecture and separation of concerns.

Technologies Used:
  • Jakarta EE: For EJB and transaction management.
  • Log4j: For logging operations.

      public ProjectBean()

  • Method Details

    • createProject

      public void createProject(ProjectCreateDto projectCreateDto, jakarta.ws.rs.core.SecurityContext securityContext) throws EntityNotFoundException, DuplicatedAttributeException, InputValidationException, UserNotFoundException, ElementAssociationException, UnknownHostException, DatabaseOperationException
      Creates a new project with the provided details.
      This method performs the following steps:
      • Validates the conclusion date and keywords.
      • Retrieves the authenticated user and validates existence.
      • Retrieves the laboratory entity and validates existence.
      • Checks for duplicate project name.
      • Creates a new project entity and persists it.
      • Defines relations for users, skills, keywords, and assets.
      • Logs the creation of the project.

      Parameters:
      projectCreateDto - the DTO containing project creation details.
      securityContext - the security context containing the authenticated user's details.
      Throws:
      EntityNotFoundException - if the user or laboratory is not found.
      DuplicatedAttributeException - if the project name is duplicated.
      InputValidationException - if the input validation fails.
      UserNotFoundException - if the authenticated user is not found.
      ElementAssociationException - if there is an error in associating elements.
      UnknownHostException - if there is an unknown host exception.
      DatabaseOperationException - if there is an error persisting the project.

    • getAllProjects

      public ArrayList<ProjectGetDto> getAllProjects()
      Retrieves a list of all projects in the system.
      This method fetches all project entities from the database and converts them into a list of ProjectGetDto objects for easier handling and presentation in the application layer.

      Returns:
      an ArrayList of ProjectGetDto representing all projects in the system.

    • getProjectDetailsById

      public ProjectGetDto getProjectDetailsById(long projectId) throws EntityNotFoundException
      Retrieves the details of a specific project by its ID.
      This method fetches the project entity associated with the provided project ID from the database and converts it into a ProjectGetDto object for easier handling and presentation in the application layer. If the project is not found, an EntityNotFoundException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      projectId - the ID of the project to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      a ProjectGetDto object representing the details of the specified project.
      Throws:
      EntityNotFoundException - if the project is not found.

    • getEnumListProjectStates

      public List<ProjectStateEnum> getEnumListProjectStates()
      Retrieves a list of all possible project states.

      This method iterates over all values of the ProjectStateEnum enumeration and adds them to a list, which is then returned. This is useful for populating dropdowns or other UI elements that need to display the possible states a project can be in.

      Returns:
      a list of ProjectStateEnum values representing all possible project states.

    • getEnumListProjectRoles

      public List<ProjectRoleEnum> getEnumListProjectRoles()
      Retrieves a list of all possible project roles.

      This method iterates over all values of the ProjectRoleEnum enumeration and adds them to a list, which is then returned. This is useful for populating dropdowns or other UI elements that need to display the possible roles within a project.

      Returns:
      a list of ProjectRoleEnum values representing all possible project roles.

    • getListProjectLogs

      public List<ProjectLogGetDto> getListProjectLogs(long projectId)
      Retrieves a list of project logs for a specific project.

      This method fetches all log entries associated with the given project ID from the database, converts each log entry to a ProjectLogGetDto object, and returns the list of DTOs.

      Logging is performed to track the fetching process and any potential errors.

      Parameters:
      projectId - the ID of the project whose logs are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      a list of ProjectLogGetDto representing the logs of the specified project.

    • approveProject

      public void approveProject(ProjectApproveDto projectApproveDto, @Context jakarta.ws.rs.core.SecurityContext securityContext) throws EntityNotFoundException, UnknownHostException
      Approves or rejects a project based on the provided approval DTO.

      This method retrieves the project and authenticated user entities, validates the current state of the project, handles the approval or rejection decision, and updates the project state accordingly. A project log entry is created to document the decision, and notifications are sent to all project members.

      Parameters:
      projectApproveDto - the DTO containing the project approval details.
      securityContext - the security context of the authenticated user.
      Throws:
      EntityNotFoundException - if the project or user is not found.
      UnknownHostException - if there is an error with the notification service.

    • getFilteredProjects

      public ProjectPaginatedDto getFilteredProjects(int page, int pageSize, jakarta.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo) throws InputValidationException
      Retrieves a paginated list of filtered projects based on the given page number, page size, and filter criteria.

      This method validates the pagination parameters, retrieves the filtered projects from the database, converts them to DTOs, and returns a paginated response containing the project DTOs and total project count.

      Parameters:
      page - the page number to retrieve, must be greater than 0.
      pageSize - the number of projects per page, must be greater than 0.
      uriInfo - the filter criteria for retrieving the projects.
      Returns:
      a ProjectPaginatedDto containing the list of project DTOs and the total project count.
      Throws:
      InputValidationException - if the page or page size is invalid.

    • updateProjectMembershipRole

      public void updateProjectMembershipRole(long projectId, ProjectRoleUpdateDto projectRoleUpdateDto, jakarta.ws.rs.core.SecurityContext securityContext) throws EntityNotFoundException, InputValidationException, DatabaseOperationException, ElementAssociationException
      Updates the role of a project member.

      This method performs the following steps:

      • Retrieves the authenticated user's details from the security context.
      • Validates the existence of the user, project, and project membership entities.
      • Checks that the project creator's role is not being changed.
      • Updates the role of the project member and logs the change.

      Parameters:
      projectId - the ID of the project.
      projectRoleUpdateDto - the DTO containing the user ID and new role.
      securityContext - the security context containing the authenticated user's details.
      Throws:
      EntityNotFoundException - if the user, project, or project membership is not found.
      InputValidationException - if the project creator's role is being changed.
      DatabaseOperationException - if there is an error updating the project membership role in the database.
      ElementAssociationException

    • updateProject

      public void updateProject(long projectId, ProjectUpdateDto projectUpdateDto, jakarta.ws.rs.core.SecurityContext securityContext) throws EntityNotFoundException, InputValidationException, UnknownHostException
      Updates the details of an existing project.

      This method performs several validation checks, updates project details, handles state transitions, and logs changes. It performs the following steps:

      • Retrieves the authenticated user from the security context.
      • Finds the project entity by its ID and validates its existence.
      • Ensures that cancelled or finished projects are not updated.
      • Checks for duplicate project names when updating the project's name.
      • Validates the provided conclusion date to ensure it is not in the past.
      • Finds the associated laboratory by its ID and validates its existence.
      • Saves the original state of the project for comparison.
      • Updates the project fields with the new data from the DTO.
      • Handles state transitions and sends notifications if necessary.
      • Compares the original and new project states and logs the changes.

      Parameters:
      projectId - The ID of the project to be updated.
      projectUpdateDto - The DTO containing the updated project details.
      securityContext - The security context containing the authenticated user's details.
      Throws:
      EntityNotFoundException - if the project or user is not found.
      InputValidationException - if the project name is duplicated, the conclusion date is in the past, or there is an invalid state transition.
      UnknownHostException - if there is an error with the host.

    • getAllProjectsIds

      public List<Long> getAllProjectsIds()
      Retrieves a list of all project IDs in the system.

      This method queries the database to get a list of all project IDs. It leverages the projectDao to perform the database operation.

      Returns:
      A list of Long values representing the IDs of all projects.

    • createProjectLog

      public void createProjectLog(ProjectEntity projectEntity, UserEntity userEntity, LogTypeEnum type, String content)
      Creates a project log entry for the given project, user, log type, and content.
      Parameters:
      projectEntity - The project entity for which the log is created.
      userEntity - The user entity who performed the action.
      type - The type of the log entry (e.g., automatic, manual).
      content - The content or description of the log entry.
      Throws:
      jakarta.persistence.PersistenceException - If there is an error while persisting the log entity.

    • createManualProjectLog

      public void createManualProjectLog(long projectId, ProjectLogCreateDto createProjectLogDto, jakarta.ws.rs.core.SecurityContext securityContext) throws EntityNotFoundException
      Creates a manual project log entry for the given project ID, log details, and authenticated user.
      Parameters:
      projectId - The ID of the project for which the log is created.
      createProjectLogDto - The DTO containing details for creating the project log.
      securityContext - The security context containing the authenticated user information.
      Throws:
      EntityNotFoundException - If the project or authenticated user cannot be found.
      jakarta.persistence.PersistenceException - If there is an error while persisting the log entity.

    • convertProjectEntityToProjectDto

      public ProjectGetDto convertProjectEntityToProjectDto(ProjectEntity projectEntity)
      Converts a ProjectEntity object to a ProjectGetDto object.

      This method creates a new ProjectGetDto and populates its fields with data from the given ProjectEntity. It converts fields such as ID, name, description, motivation, state, dates, approval status, associated laboratory, creator information, and project members.

      Parameters:
      projectEntity - The ProjectEntity object to convert.
      Returns:
      A ProjectGetDto object populated with data from the ProjectEntity.

    • convertProjectEntityListToProjectDtoList

      public ArrayList<ProjectGetDto> convertProjectEntityListToProjectDtoList(ArrayList<ProjectEntity> projectEntities)
      Converts a list of ProjectEntity objects to a list of ProjectGetDto objects.

      This method iterates over the provided list of ProjectEntity objects, converting each ProjectEntity to a ProjectGetDto using convertProjectEntityToProjectDto(ProjectEntity). It returns an ArrayList containing all converted ProjectGetDto objects.

      Parameters:
      projectEntities - The ArrayList of ProjectEntity objects to convert.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of ProjectGetDto objects populated with data from the ProjectEntity objects.

    • convertProjectMembershipEntityToDto

      public ProjectMembershipDto convertProjectMembershipEntityToDto(ProjectMembershipEntity projectMembershipEntity)
      Converts a ProjectMembershipEntity object to a ProjectMembershipDto object.

      This method creates a new ProjectMembershipDto instance and populates it with data from the provided ProjectMembershipEntity. It sets the id, userId, projectId, role, accepted status, and user information by converting the associated UserEntity to a UserBasicInfoDto using UserBean.convertUserEntitytoUserBasicInfoDto(UserEntity).

      Parameters:
      projectMembershipEntity - The ProjectMembershipEntity object to convert.
      Returns:
      A ProjectMembershipDto object populated with data from the ProjectMembershipEntity.

    • convertProjectMembershipEntityListToDto

      public ArrayList<ProjectMembershipDto> convertProjectMembershipEntityListToDto(Set<ProjectMembershipEntity> projectMemberships)
      Converts a Set of ProjectMembershipEntity objects to an ArrayList of ProjectMembershipDto objects.

      This method iterates through each ProjectMembershipEntity in the provided set and converts it to a ProjectMembershipDto using convertProjectMembershipEntityToDto(ProjectMembershipEntity). It then adds each converted ProjectMembershipDto to an ArrayList, which is returned as the result.

      Parameters:
      projectMemberships - The Set of ProjectMembershipEntity objects to convert.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of ProjectMembershipDto objects populated with data from the ProjectMembershipEntity set.
